qas.question: What magnifies the small radiation resistance of a loop?

answers.text: a capacitor at the frequency of operation

qas.question: What is used in most AM broadcaster receivers?
What is resonated by a capacitor along with the receiver tuning that maintains resonance over the AM broadcast band?
When using a small loop antenna at a low frequency, what may occur?

context: Another extreme case of <a3_0>impedance matching<a3_0/> occurs when using a small loop antenna (usually, but not always, for receiving) at a relatively low frequency where it appears almost as a pure inductor. Resonating such an inductor with <a0_0>a capacitor at the frequency of operation<a0_0/> not only cancels the reactance but greatly magnifies the very small radiation resistance of such a <a1_0>loop<a1_0/>.[citation needed] This is implemented in most AM broadcast receivers, with a <a2_0>small ferrite loop antenna<a2_0/> resonated by a capacitor which is varied along with the receiver tuning in order to maintain resonance over the AM broadcast band
